required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Re-examination Study for General Drug Use to Assess the Safety and Efficacy Profile of JANUMET in Usual Practice

brief_summary.textblock: This survey is conducted for preparing application materials for re-examination under the Pharmaceutical Affairs Laws and its Enforcement Regulation, its aim is to reconfirm the clinical usefulness of sitagliptin/metformin (JANUMET) through collecting the safety and efficacy information according to the Re-examination Regulation for New Drugs.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Any Adverse Experience
primary_outcome.description: An adverse event (AE) is any unfavorable and unintended change in the structure, function or chemistry of the body temporally associated with study drug administration whether or not considered related to the use of the product.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to Treatment in Hemoglobin HbA1c (A1C) at Week 12
primary_outcome.description: HbA1C is found when high blood levels of glucose combines with hemoglobin to form glycated hemoglobin. The average amount of glucose in blood over a prolonged periods of time can be determined by measuring a hemoglobin A1c level which is reported as a percentage (%). The change from baseline reflects the Week 12 A1C minus Week 0 A1C.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to Treatment in Fasting Plasma Glucose (FPG) at Week 12
primary_outcome.description: Blood glucose was measured on a fasting basis (collected after an 8- to 10-hour fast). FPG is expressed as mg/dL. Therefore, this change from baseline reflects the Week 12 FPG minus Week 0 FPG.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in 2-hour Post Prandial Glucose (2hr-PPG) at Week 12
primary_outcome.description: Blood glucose was measured 2 hours after a meal (2hr-PPG). 2hr-PPG is expressed as mg/dL. Therefore, this change from baseline reflects the Week 12 2hr-PPG minus Week 0 2hr-PPG.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With an Overall Efficacy Evaluation by the Investigator of Improved, Stable, or Worse at Week 12
primary_outcome.description: Overall efficacy analysis was conducted on participants who have used study drug for more than 12 weeks and whose improvement of the disease has been assessed by Principal investigator. The investigator's global assessment of disease improvement was classified as either: "Improved", "Stable" and "Worse" in a Medical History/Physical Examination form.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to Treatment in HbA1c at Week 24
primary_outcome.description: HbA1C is blood marker used to report average blood glucose levels over a prolonged periods of time and is reported as a percentage (%). Therefore, this change from baseline reflects the Week 24 A1C minus Week 0 A1C.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to Treatment in FPG at Week 24
primary_outcome.description: Blood glucose was measured on a fasting basis (collected after an 8- to 10-hour fast). FPG is expressed as mg/dL. Therefore, this change from baseline reflects the Week 24 FPG minus Week 0 FPG.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in 2hr-PPG at Week 24
primary_outcome.description: Blood glucose was measured 2 hours after a meal (2hr-PPG). 2hr-PPG is expressed as mg/dL. Therefore, this change from baseline reflects the Week 24 2hr-PPG minus Week 0 2hr-PPG.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With an Overall Efficacy Evaluation by the Investigator of Improved, Stable, or Worse at Week 24
primary_outcome.description: Overall efficacy analysis was conducted on participants who have used study drug for more than 24 weeks and whose improvement of the disease has been assessed by Principal investigator. The investigator's global assessment of disease improvement was classified as either: "Improved", "Stable" and "Worse" in a Medical History/Physical Examination form.

arm_group.description: Korean participants with type 2 diabetes mellitus treated with sitagliptin/metformin

intervention.description: Sitagliptin/metformin 50/500 mg, 50/850 mg, or 50/1000 mg tablet administered twice daily with meals.

study_pop.textblock: Korean participants with type 2 diabetes mellitus treated with sitagliptin/metformin in usual practice

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Has type 2 diabetes mellitus
- Is treated with sitagliptin/metformin within local label for the first time
Exclusion Criteria:
- Has a contraindication to sitagliptin/metformin according to the local label
- Is treated with sitagliptin/metformin before contract and out of enrollment period

participant_flow.recruitment_details: In this post-marketing surveillance study of sitagliptin/metformin (JANUMET®), participants in South Korea treated for >= 24 weeks were evaluated for long-term safety and efficacy. During the re-examination study period (December 4, 2005 to September 20, 2013), case report forms (CRFs) were collected from 4,065 participants.

group.title: All Participants Included in the Safety Evaluation
group.description: Korean participants with type 2 diabetes mellitus treated with sitagliptin/metformin

baseline.population: Baseline characteristics were only reported for the Safety Population (4033) who qualified for the study and not for the 4065 participants from whom CRFs were collected.

group.title: All Participants Included in the Safety Evaluation
group.description: Korean participants with type 2 diabetes mellitus treated with sitagliptin/metformin

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Any Adverse Experience
outcome.description: An adverse event (AE) is any unfavorable and unintended change in the structure, function or chemistry of the body temporally associated with study drug administration whether or not considered related to the use of the product.
outcome.population: All participants who were included in the safety evaluation

group.title: All Participants Included in the Safety Evaluation
group.description: Korean participants with type 2 diabetes mellitus treated with sitagliptin/metformin

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Any Adverse Experience
measure.description: An adverse event (AE) is any unfavorable and unintended change in the structure, function or chemistry of the body temporally associated with study drug administration whether or not considered related to the use of the product.
measure.population: All participants who were included in the safety evaluation

outcome.title: Change From Baseline to Treatment in Hemoglobin HbA1c (A1C) at Week 12
outcome.description: HbA1C is found when high blood levels of glucose combines with hemoglobin to form glycated hemoglobin. The average amount of glucose in blood over a prolonged periods of time can be determined by measuring a hemoglobin A1c level which is reported as a percentage (%). The change from baseline reflects the Week 12 A1C minus Week 0 A1C.
outcome.population: All participants with a pre-treatment and a 12-week post-treatment HbA1c value.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: In regard to surveillance result, any publication should be agreed by sponsor in advance.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Senior Vice President, Global Clinical Development
